messageBody:
Interesting topic, but in my opinion, Java is too simple a language
(syntactically anyway) to lend itself to "programming gems".

While it's indeed possible to see 20-line snippets in C, C++ or Perl that
might make you go "wow, pretty", I don't think we can achieve this in Java
because its syntax is so regular and clear (Generics excepted :-)).

Therefore, a Java test gem can only be observed at a more "macro" level:
involving a few classes, making clever use of inheritance and other Java
mechanisms, showing a set of test classes that are easy to read, maintain
and extend by future programmers, or sets of methods that represent a
"minimal spanning test tree" of test classes (as few test classes as you can
to entirely test a certain functionality of your code), etc...

--
Cédric
